meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a quick, sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He bopped the ball with his hand.
meanings.sent2: The boxer bopped his opponent on the nose.
meanings.sent3: The fly annoying him, he bopped it away.
meanings.sent4: She bopped the idea out of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The hammer bopped the nail into the wood.

meanings.definition: To dance or move energetically to music.
meanings.sent1: She bopped to the beat of the song.
meanings.sent2: The kids bopped around the living room to the music.
meanings.sent3: The cat bopped its head to the music, looking funny.
meanings.sent4: Her heart bopped with joy as she danced.
meanings.sent5: The dancers bopped gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To move or travel quickly and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit bopped out of the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The car bopped down the road in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The idea bopped into his head out of nowhere.
meanings.sent4: Time bopped along as they raced to catch the train.
meanings.sent5: The ball bopped unpredictably in different directions.
